title: Mosiac blocks in Illustrator 10
content:
Ok, lets say I want to produce a huge grid of squares all at say 1", and a gap between each of say .1" -- whats the best way to go about this, so I can have it percise. I really dont want to have to duplicate these all by hand, not to mention I need them to be percise.   
   
Ideas?
author: Hildebrant

comments.content:
Kyle, try this:   
   
Draw a square 1"   
Cmd+Shift+M (Ctrl+Shift+M)   
Enter 1.1in in the Horizontal field (0 in other fields)   
Press Copy   
Press Cmd+D(Ctrl+D) for as many as you need horizontally   
Now select all your boxes   
Cmd+Shift+M (Ctrl+Shift+M) again   
Enter 1.1in in the vertical field (0 in other fields) (copies upward -1.1in would copy downward)   
Press Copy   
Press Cmd+D(Ctrl+D) for as many as you need vertically   
   
Hope this helps.   
   
I suppose you could make a pattern tile and tile the area but I hardly ever do this so I can't remember how.   
   
Jon
Thanks Jon -- I actually figured it out before I got a reply. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018110453im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
